actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources requested executive comment from Labor Department; OMB.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

official_title: A bill to amend the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to specify the necessity of a warrant when the owner, operator, or agent in charge of any workplace refuses entry, and for other purposes.
short_title: Occupational Safety and Health Amendments of 1982

summary.text: Occupational Safety and Health Amendments of 1982 - Amends the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to require a warrant when the owner, operator, or agent in charge of any workplace refuses entry to an OSHA inspector.

titles.title: Occupational Safety and Health Amendments of 1982

A bill to amend the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to specify the necessity of a warrant when the owner, operator, or agent in charge of any workplace refuses entry, and for other purposes.
